column1: concede_finland_title;Abandon Finland;Abandonner la Finlande;Aufgabe Finnlands;;Abandonar Finlandia;;;;;;;;
concede_finland_desc;Many decades have passed since the defeat of the Swedish armies in the Finnish War
column2: and the passing of our country's eastern half to captivity under the Russian Eagle. Although reports from Finland speak of widespread discontent with Russian rule
column3: very few seem to yearn for a reunification with Sweden
column4: instead preferring to seek direct Finnish independence and autonomy. Some say it is time for us to abandon all thoughts of a Swedish return to Finland;Plusieurs d?ennies se sont ?oul?s depuis la d?aite des arm?s su?oises dans la Guerre de Finlande
column5: et le passage de la moiti?orientale de notre pays ?la captivit?sous le joug de l'aigle russe. Bien que les rapports de Finlande parlent du m?ontentement g??al caus?par la domination russe
column6: peu semblent aspirer ?une r?nification avec la Su?e
column7: et pr??ent directement solliciter l'ind?endance de la Finlande. Certains disent qu'il est temps pour nous d'abandonner tout espoir d'un retour de la Su?e en Finlande.;Viele Jahrzehnte sind seit der Niederlage der schwedischen Armeen im Finnischen Krieg und der ?ergabe der ?tlichen H?fte unseres Landes in die Knechtschaft unter dem russischen Adler vergangen. Obwohl Berichte aus Finnland weit verbreiteten Unmut mit der russischen Herrschaft melden
column8: suchen sehr wenige Menschen die Wiedervereinigung mit Schweden und ziehen stattdessen direkte finnische Unabh?gigkeit und Autonomie vor. Manche sagen
column9: es sei f? uns an der Zeit
column10: alle Gedanken an eine R?kkehr Finnlands in den Scho?Schwedens aufzugeben.;;Han transcurrido ya muchas d?adas desde la derrota de los ej?citos suecos en la guerra de Finlandia y la ca?a de la mitad oriental de nuestro reino bajo el yugo del ?uila rusa. Aunque nos informan de que los finlandeses est? muy descontentos con el gobierno ruso
column11: pocos parecen desear una reunificaci? con Suecia y se decantan m? bien por buscar su autonom?. Algunos dicen que es hora de abandonar la idea de reunificar Finlandia y Suecia.;;;;;;;;

column1: gag_rule_title;House Gag Rule;R?le du silence ?la Chambre;Maulkorberlass;;Limitaci? de los poderes de la c?ara;;;;;;;;
gag_rule_desc;The seemingly irresolvable debate over slavery threatens to tear our country apart. If we were to introduce a gag rule in the House of Representatives
column2: barring bills on the slavery issue from being presented to the House
column3: we could hope to at least alleviate some of the worst tensions;Le d?at apparament insoluble sur l'esclavage menace de diviser notre pays. Si nous mettions en place une r?le du silence ?la Chambre des repr?entants
column4: afin d'emp?her qu'un projet de loi sur l'esclavage soit soumis
column5: nous pourrions au moins esp?er calmer les pires tensions.;Die anscheinend unl?bare Debatte ?er die Sklaverei droht unser Land zu zerrei?n. Wenn wir einen Maulkorberlass im Repr?entantenhaus verf?en
column6: der verhindert
column7: dass Gesetzesvorlagen zur Sklaverei dem Haus unterbreitet werden
column8: haben wir wenigstens Hoffnung
column9: die schlimmsten Spannungen zu lindern;;El debate aparentemente irresoluble sobre la esclavitud amenaza con destruir nuestro pa?. Si limitamos la independencia de la c?ara de representantes prohibiendo la presentaci? de proyectos de ley relativos a la esclavitud
column10: es posible que contribuyamos a aliviar la tensi?.;;;;;;;;

column1: clay_and_douglas_draft_title;Clay & Douglas Draft;La proposition de Clay et Douglas;Clay & Douglas-Gesetzentwurf;;La propuesta de Clay y Douglas;;;;;;;;

clay_and_douglas_draft_desc;Senators Henry Clay and Stephen A. Douglas have presented a draft proposal for a compromise on the slavery issue centered around the premise of popular sovereignty as the determinant for slavery or abolitionism in the territories. By supporting the draft proposal
column2: we could calm tensions over the slavery issue for at least some time.;Les s?ateurs Henry Clay et Stephen A. Douglas ont pr?ent?un projet de loi pour un compromis sur la question de l'esclavage
column3: bas?sur la souverainet?populaire
column4: qui serait un facteur d?isif sur la conservation ou l'abolition de l'esclavage dans certains territoires. En supportant ce projet
column5: nous pourions calmer les tensions pendant quelques temps.;Die Senatoren Henry Clay und Stephen A. Douglas haben einen Gesetzesentwurf f? einen Kompromiss zum Sklavereiproblem vorgelegt
column6: der auf die Pr?isse baut
column7: dass die Volkssouver?it? der entscheidende Faktor zur Entscheidung ?er Sklaverei oder die Abschaffung derselben in den jeweiligen Territorien sei. Durch Unterst?zung dieses Entwurfs k?nen wir die Spannungen zur Sklaverei zumindest eine Weile lang mildern.;;Los senadores Henry Clay y Stephen A. Douglas han presentado un borrador para un compromiso sobre la cuesti? de la esclavitud
column8: centrado en la premisa de la soberan? popular como principio de la esclavitud o el abolicionismo en cada territorio. Si lo apoyamos
column9: podremos calmar las tensiones generadas por el problema de la esclavitud
column10: al menos por alg? tiempo.;;;;;;;;

column1: corwin_amendment_title;Corwin Amendment;Amendement Corwin;Corwin Amendment;;La Enmienda Corwin;;;;;;;;
corwin_amendment_desc;Tensions over slavery are about to reach the boiling point. By introducing Senator Thomas Corwin's proposed constitutional amendment
column2: we can bar congress from enacting any constitutional amendments banning or interfering slavery. This measure is desperate
column3: but so is the situation.;Les tensions sur l'esclavage sont sur le point d'atteindre l'?ullition. En pr?entant la proposition d'amendement constitutionnel du s?ateur Thomas Corwin
column4: nous pouvons emp?her le congr? de promulger n'importe quel amendement banissant ou entravant l'esclavage. Cette mesure est d?esp??
column5: mais la situation l'est ?alement.;Die Spannungen wegen des Sklavereiproblems stehen kurz vor dem Siedepunkt. Durch die Vorstellung von Senator Thomas Corwins Vorschlag zur Verfassungs?derung k?nen wir den Kongress daran hindern

bixby_letter_desc;I have been shown in the files of the War Department a statement of the Adjutant General of Massachusetts that you are the mother of five sons who have died gloriously on the field of battle. I feel how weak and fruitless must be any word of mine which should attempt to beguile you from the grief of a loss so overwhelming. But I cannot refrain from tendering you the consolation that may be found in the thanks of the Republic they died to save.' -- Abraham Lincoln\n\nBy sending a letter to Mrs. Bixby we can muster additional support for the war effort.;Je viens de voir dans les dossiers du minist?e de la guerre un rapport de l'Adjudant g??al du Massachusetts disant que vous ?es la m?e de cinq fils

L?doption de cette loi d?end de votre vote.;Besorgte Stimmen im Lande verlangen nun

EVTDESC3202;From time to time we... modify... the maps of the political constituencies to better... conform with what we believe people truly want out of the political system. If we notice that the wrong party is gaining traction where we do not feel that they should
column2: we simply redefine the voter uptake area for the constituency to better match... a more reasonable policy. We've noticed that there has been a strong voiced support for liberal policies in one of our provinces recently
column3: and we're not sure that the area should be allowed to actually vote along those lines. We could bring in some neighboring districts to form a strong conservative base in the entire state
column4: but we would increase local militancy by doing so.;De temps en temps nous modifions

EVTDESC3204;A major instance of voting fraud has occurred in an election for a local assembly in one of our states. We have every reason to believe that the vote was actually a major victory for local conservatives
column2: but the liberal party has nevertheless claimed victory. Stepping in from a national level to correct these frauds is what is expected of us

EVTDESC3301;As our average life expectancies have increased over the years
column2: more and more families have had to take care of their elderly who are no longer able to provide for themselves. The social makeup of our country is changing
column3: and without much in way of a national plan for the elderly and the disabled
column4: a lot are falling between the cracks in the system. Conservatives have by and large taken the stance that the family is the first and last social support structure for the elderly
column5: and that an increasing role for government in the area threatens to unravel important societal bonds. Liberals
column6: on the other hand
column7: see our pensions as tragically lacking

column9: seemingly

EVTDESC3600;The tortured scream made the whole factory stop. The man pulled and pulled so that the machine would let go of his badly wounded arm. When the machine reluctantly spat out his arm
column2: he fell unconscious to the ground. His colleagues flocked around him and the foreman had to tell them twice to get out of the way and get back to work. The wounded man was carried out while the silent crowd resumed its work.;Un cri per?nt a retenti et toute l'usine s?st arr??. column3: il est tomb??terre sans connaissance. Ses coll?ues se sont assembl? autour de lui et le contrema?re a d?leur dire deux fois de se disperser et de revenir ?leur poste de travail. column2:
Mr. Brown had a tough workweek.
Monday: nearly lost his eyesight on his left eye due to an careless coworker and a ladder.
Tuesday: ruined his best shirt in an desperate attempt to save his arm from a gluttonous machine.
Wednesday: escaped by near fright when a brick came tumbling down from above
column3:
dropped by a construction worker.
Thursday: slipped on an oil slick and nearly broke his neck.
Friday: choked on a piece of sandwich but was saved by a thump on his back.
Some of his accidents could have been avoided if the safety regulations in the factory were followed.;En d?it de toute sa prudence

EVTDESC3606;Warnings about yellow phosphorus causing phossy jaw have begun spreading in the match industry. Phossy jaw is a painful disease with painful toothaches and swelling of the gums as first symptoms. The jaw bones will over time begin to abscess and surgical removal of the afflicted bones is then the only medical option available to save the patient. Our medical expertise have recommend a switch to the use of the safer
column2: but more expensive
column3: red phosphorus
column4: as it would stop the disease.;Les recommandations au sujet du phosphore jaune causant le Phossy Jaw (n?rose phosphor? de la m?hoire) ont commenc?se r?andre au sein de l'industrie de fabrication des allumettes. EVTNAME3754;The Cato Street Conspiracy;Le complot de la rue Cato;Die Cato Street-Verschw?ung;;La conspiraci? de Cato Street;;;;;;;;
EVTDESC3754;A group of known radicals have been assembling at a central townhouse on Cato Street regularly for several months. The group's outspoken radical republican agenda
column2: and its attempts to recruit new members
column3: have led local officials to raise concerned eyebrows
column4: and to keeping watchful eyes on the group. In a dawn raid by police early this morning
column5: suspicions were confirmed as the group was caught red-handed planning an assault on a known member of the Cabinet
column6: in preparation for a future coup d'etat. Although we never risked the plan seeing fruition
column7: the incident has sparked a debate in the Upper House on the need to curtail and regulate the right to assemble.;Un groupe connu de radicaux s?st r?ni pendant plusieurs mois dans une maison du centre ville situ? rue Cato. Ce groupe de radicaux r?ublicains tente de recruter de nouveaux membres ce qui a amen?les autorit? locales ?les surveiller avec beaucoup d?ttention. T? ce matin l? une descente de police rue Cato a permis de confirmer les soup?ns qui pesaient sur ce groupe. En effet il pr?oyait une action de force contre un membre du Gouvernement avec pour objectif ultime de cr?r les conditions d?n coup d?tat. Bien que la menace ait ??d?ou?
column8: l'incident a suscit?une discussion ?la Chambre haute sur la n?essit?de limiter le droit de se r?nir.;Eine Gruppe bekannter Radikaler trifft sich schon seit Monaten regelm?ig in einem zentralen Stadthaus an der Cato Street. Die radikalen republikanischen Ziele der Gruppe sowie ihre Versuche

column14: hat der Vorfall eine Debatte im Oberhaus dar?er ausgel?t
column15: ob das Versammlungsrecht beschr?kt und reguliert werden sollte.;;Un grupo de conocidos radicales lleva reuni?dose varios meses en una casa c?trica en Cato Street. La agenda republicana radical del grupo y sus intentos de reclutar a nuevos miembros

EVTNAME3756;Reform Rally;Manifestation pour la r?orme;Reform-Kundgebung;;Llamada a la reforma;;;;;;;;
EVTDESC3756;People have taken to the streets in one of our states
column2: exasperated over the lack of political representation
column3: and held a rally
column4: calling on the government to institute political reform. While the rally has largely been a peaceful affair
column5: several incendiary speeches were held during it
column6: and tensions between conservatives and liberals are running high. Local aristocrats are calling on the government to condemn the speeches made at the rally
column7: and muster support for holding back political reforms and protect the established order. Supporting the aristocratic call means angering local progressives
column8: but not doing it means angering both conservatives and aristocrats.;Les gens sont descendus dans les rues d'un de nos Etats
column9: exasp?? par l'absence de repr?entation politique
column10: et ils ont organis?un rassemblement
column11: demandant au gouvernement d'engager des r?ormes politiques. Alors que la marche a ??en grande partie une affaire pacifique
column12: plusieurs discours incendiaires ont ??tenus

column14: et de mobiliser le soutien pour freiner les r?ormes politiques et prot?er l'ordre ?abli. Soutenir l'appel des aristocratique peut f?her les progressistes locaux
column15: mais ne pas le faire cela signifie mettre en col?e ?la fois les conservateurs et les aristocrates.;Erbittert ?er den Mangel an politischer Repr?entation sind die Menschen in einem unserer Staaten auf die Stra? gegangen und haben eine Kundgebung abgehalten

column21: und die etablierte Ordnung zu sch?zen. Unterst?zung der Aristokraten bedeutet
column22: die ?tlichen Progressiven zu ver?gern
column23: aber Nichtstun w?de den Zorn sowohl der Konservativen als auch der Aristokraten sch?en.;;La gente ha tomado las calles de uno de nuestros estados

Los arist?ratas locales han pedido al gobierno que condene los discursos hechos en el mitin y han buscado apoyo para evitar la reforma pol?ica y proteger el orden establecido. EVTDESC4101;Discontent has been brewing in broad stratas of the population for some time over the issue of our appointed upper house. Many people are disappointed with the poor representation afforded to them by the present representational system
column2: and a long period of agitation has begun to form public opinion on the issue. Violent state wide protests have erupted in one of our states
column3: and we need to decide what the government's position on the issue should be. Writing the question off completely will anger the population
column4: and strengthen the local opinion against the appointed house. Making compromises will mean a strengthening of the liberal position in the Upper House
column5: and will also anger conservatives.;Le m?ontentement couvait depuis un certain temps de strates importantes de la population

column1: EVTNAME4200;Professor Criticizes Voting System;Un professeur critique le mode de scrutin;Professor kritisiert das Wahlsystem;;Un profesor critica el sistema de voto;;;;;;;;

EVTDESC4200;A professor at one of our most prestigious universities has published a tract on political philosophy. The tract argues in favor of a variant of the Jefferson method for appointing representatives to the Upper House. The Jefferson method is a highest averages method
column2: and the purpose of it is to allocate seats in proportion to the number of votes a particular party list has received
column3: by maintaining the ratio of votes received to seats allocated as close as possible. The tract has received a fair amount of both national and international attention. The publication gives us a window of opportunity to try to reform our voting system
column4: but we could perhaps be content with some international prestige on account of the publication instead? What is the government's position?;Un professeur ?l'un de nos plus prestigieuses universit? a publi?un tract sur la philosophie politique. Il plaide en faveur d'une variante de la m?hode de Jefferson pour nommer des repr?entants ?la Chambre haute. La m?hode de Jefferson est un proc??des hautes moyennes

EVTNAME4201;Political Reform Club;Club pr?ant la r?orme politique;Verein f? Politische Reformen;;Asociaci? pol?ica reformista;;;;;;;;
EVTDESC4201;A nationwide political reform club has formed in $COUNTRY$. The club has made it its agenda to reform the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ voting system
column2: and they have initially been able to gain a fair amount of political traction in the public debate. The club wants to see our Jeffersonian voting system replaced with one of proportional representation. The club argues that a proportional representation allows for a fairer and more balanced representation for the totality of our population
column3: rather than for arbitrary political voting circles. With the amount of traction that the club has been able to garner
column4: we would be hard pressed if we gave it no attention
column5: on the other hand
column6: reform might not be on our agenda right now.;Un club de r?orme politique nationale s'est form?en $COUNTRY$. Le club a fait son ordre du jour sur la r?orme du syst?e de vote $COUNTRY_ADJ$

EVTDESC4202;With the Upper House firmly in liberal hands
column2: our population seems to have given us a clear and unequivocal mandate for political reform. This could be a good opportunity to reform our voting system
column3: but the question is: In which direction? With the clear mandate we have
column4: we could choose to go in more or less any direction
column5: and the options that seem to lie on the table are a first past the post system and a Jeffersonian method. While we will still have to drag the reforms through our legislative bodies
column6: this could be a good opportunity to build momentum.;Avec la Chambre haute fermement en des mains lib?ales

EVTDESC4300;The mob assembled outside the national legislative assembly is frustrated and angry
column2: and the anger is directed directly at us. Our population is up in ire over the issue of charter reform. They want the vote
column3: and some hot-heads in the crowd are even hinting at taking it by force if they don't get it. Despite certain radicals
column4: the movement for charter reform is still largely keeping itself within the bounds of peaceful protest. The options our government finds itself faced with are to either support the charter reform movement
column5: or to oppose it
column6: and the choice really shouldn't be too hard.;La foule rassembl? ?l'ext?ieur de l'assembl? nationale l?islative est frustr? et en col?e

EVTNAME4301;Landed Voting Criticized;Critique du syst?e ?ectoral censitaire;Kritik an Grundbesitzerwahl;;Criticado el voto por tierras;;;;;;;;
EVTDESC4301;Our voting system is heavily based on and around the ownership of land. A case has gained some notoriety in one of our states
column2: where a young widow has been denied the voting rights tied to her estate
column3: on account of the estate quickly losing market value due to falling prices in the area. The event has led to a wider discussion on the landed voting system in general
column4: and several reform minded ideas are circulating in intellectual and progressive circles. The issue on the table is what stance the government should take on the case's principal issue. Should we attempt to fix voting indexes
column5: and anger the poor strata of the local population
column6: or allow them to fluctuate?;Notre syst?e ?ectoral est fortement bas? sur et autour de la propri??des terres. Un cas a acquis une certaine notori??dans l'un de nos Etats
column7: o?une jeune veuve s'est vu refus? les droits de vote attach? ?sa propri?? pour la raison que la succession pouvait rapidement perdre de la valeur en raison de la baisse des prix dans la zone. L'??ement a donn?lieu ?une discussion plus large sur le syst?e de vote
column8: et des id?s de r?ormes circulent dans les milieux intellectuels et progressistes. La question sur la table est quelle est la position que le gouvernement devrait prendre est le probl?e principal de l'affaire. Devrions-nous tenter de fixer les indices de vote
column9: et mettre en col?e les couches pauvres de la population locale
column10: ou leur permettre de fluctuer ? ;Unser Wahlsystem st?zt sich auf und dreht sich um Landbesitz. Ein nun schon ber?htigter Fall ist in einem unserer Staaten aufgetreten

column13: und eine Reihe von Reformideen zirkulieren nun in den Kreisen der Intellektuellen und Progressiven. Es geht darum
column14: welche Position die Regierung zu diesem Fall einnehmen soll. Sollten wir versuchen
column15: Wahlindexe festzusetzen und uns den ?ger der ?meren Klassen zuziehen
column16: oder erlauben wir ihnen

A una joven viuda se le ha negado el derecho al voto vinculado a sus tierras debido al descenso de valor de mercado de las mismas por la ca?a de precios de la zona. El suceso ha llevado a una discusi? a? m? ampl? sobre el sistema de votos por tierras en general y est? circulando varias ideas reformistas en los c?culos intelectuales y progresistas. El asunto que tenemos sobre la mesa es el siguiente: ?u?postura debe adoptar el gobierno sobre el problema de fondo del caso? ?ebemos intentar resolver los ?dices de votos

EVTNAME4302;Wealth Based Voting;Droit de vote bas?sur la fortune;Reichtumbasierte Wahl;;Voto por ingresos;;;;;;;;

EVTDESC4302;Suffrage in $COUNTRY$ is directly based on the ownership of wealth and property. The fundamental principle is that only those who contribute to the common good should have a say in how that public good is managed and administered. One interesting consequence of this system has surfaced in one of our states
column2: where several local merchants and traders from the middle classes have started earning enough to be allowed representation. Adjusting the rules will be seen as an adjustment to exclude certain social classes
column3: and will not be appreciated by the richer classes. Disenfranchising the newly enfranchised middle classes risks a sharp rise in local militancy.;Le suffrage en $COUNTRY$ est directement fond?sur la propri??des richesses et des biens. Le principe fondamental est que seuls ceux qui contribuent au bien commun doivent avoir mot ?dire dans la fa?n de g?er le bien public. Une cons?uence int?essante de ce syst?e est apparu dans un de nos Etats

EVTNAME4303;An Argument Over Money;Un d?at sur l'argent;Eine Auseinandersetzung um Geld;;Discusi? por dinero;;;;;;;;

EVTDESC4303;A discussion is being held in one of our state assemblies on the issue of our wealth based voting system. Opponents argue that the present system is set by design to permanently and lastingly disenfranchise broad stratas of the population. We have the options of leaving the discussion
column2: and hoping that it stays on a local level
column3: or intervening to defend the present system
column4: and raise the discussion to a national level.;Une discussion se tient dans une de nos assembl?s d'Etat sur la question de notre syst?e de vote bas?sur la richesse. Les opposants affirment que le syst?e actuel est fix?par sa conception m?e de fa?n permanente et durable
column5: privant des strates large de la population. Nous avons les options de quitter la discussion
column6: et en esp?ant qu'il reste sur un niveau local
column7: ou d'intervenir pour d?endre le syst?e actuel

Los que se oponen al mismo argumentan que est?dise?do para evitar que las clases m? amplias de la sociedad tengan poder de forma permanente. Tenemos la opciones de dejar la discusi?

EVTDESC14500;A dry spell in one of our colonies has caused friction between colonial officials and locals. The lion's share of the reservoired water in the area has been diverted to colonial factories and plantations
column2: leaving many local smallholders with insufficient water for irrigation. As the days turn into weeks
column3: tensions continue to rise. Diverting more water to local farms is an option
column4: but might be viewed internationally as a sign of weakness.;Une vague de s?heresse dans l'une de nos colonies a caus?des frictions entre les autorit? coloniales et les locaux. La part du lion de l'eau en r?ervoir dans la r?ion a ??d?ourn? vers les usines et les plantations coloniales

EVTDESC15140;A committee of $PROVINCECULTURE$ businessmen and traders from $PROVINCENAME$ have approached the government in $CAPITAL$
column2: wishing to lodge a formal complaint with the open discrimination they face in competition for government contracts. Our government currently pursues a favorization policy -- preferring $COUNTRY_ADJ$ contractors wherever possible -- and this is causing discontent in the $PROVINCECULTURE$ provinces. The committee represents equally the interests of the artisan and capitalist classes of the province
column3: and we could try to sow discontent among them.;Un comit?d'hommes d'affaires $PROVINCECULTURE$ et des commer?nts de $PROVINCENAME$ ont approch?le gouvernement ?$CAPITAL$

column1: EVTDESC15160;A secret $COUNTRY_ADJ$ weapons cache in $PROVINCENAME$ was found broken up and looted early this morning. Among the loot was at least one major artillery piece. $PROVINCECULTURE$ partisans have claimed responsibility
column2: and local officials are now fearful of having to deal with a heavily armed resistance in the event of a $PROVINCECULTURE$ uprising in $PROVINCENAME$. Concerns have also been raised that this will embolden the already radicalized $PROVINCECULTURE$ independence movement.;Une cache secr?e $COUNTRY_ADJ$ d'armes en $PROVINCENAME$ a ??trouv? vandaliser et piller t? ce matin. Parmi le butin figure au moins une pi?e d'artillerie. Les partisans $PROVINCECULTURE$ en ont revendiqu?la responsabilit? et les autorit? locales ont maintenant peur d'avoir ?traiter avec une r?istance lourdement arm? dans le cas d'un soul?ement $PROVINCECULTURE$ en $PROVINCENAME$. Des Inqui?udes ont ?alement ??soulev?s que cela enhardisse le mouvement d'ind?endance d??bien radicalis? ;Heute Morgen wurde in $PROVINCENAME$ ein geheimes $COUNTRY_ADJ$es Waffenversteck aufgebrochen und gepl?dert aufgefunden. Zu der Beute geh?te mindestens ein schweres Artilleriegesch?z. $PROVINCECULTURE$e Partisanen haben die Verantwortung f? die Aktion ?ernommen. Lokale Offizielle bef?chten nun

column4: dass diese Aktion die bereits radikalisierte $PROVINCECULTURE$e Unabh?gigkeitsbewegung zus?zlich ermutigen k?nte.;;Un zulo secreto de armas

column6: como m?imo

column8: y ahora los oficiales locales temen tener que v?selas con una resistencia muy bien armada en caso de una revuelta $PROVINCECULTURE$ en $PROVINCENAME$. Tambi? ha aumentado la preocupaci? de que esto pudiera envalentonar al ya radicalizado movimiento independentista de la poblaci? $PROVINCECULTURE$.;;;;;;;;

EVTDESC15180;The philosophy of Organic Work developed in occupied Poland
column2: largely as a response to attempts at suppressing Polish national identity and culture undertaken by Prussian and Russian authorities. The philosophy
column3: influenced by the Positivism of Auguste Comte
column4: Herbert Spencer and John Stuart Mill
column5: stated in essence that productive work
column6: rather than revolution and uprising
column7: was the key to developing a national consciousness and
column8: ultimately
column9: the way to peacefully strive for national liberation. As in Poland
column10: so also in $PROVINCENAME$;Cette philosophie
column11: d?elopp? en Pologne occup?
column12: est une r?onse aux tentatives de suppression de l'identit?et de la culture nationale polonaise
column13: entreprises par les autorit? prussiennes et russes. Influenc? par le positivisme d'Auguste Comte
column14: d'Herbert Spencer et de John Stuart Mill
column15: elle d?lare en substance que le travail productif
column16: plut? que la r?olution et le soul?ement
column17: est la cl?du d?eloppement d'une conscience nationale et
column18: en d?initive
column19: la fa?n de s'efforcer pacifiquement vers une lib?ation nationale. Comme en Pologne
column20: et aussi ?$PROVINCENAME$.;Die Philosophie der organischen Arbeit entstand im besetzten Polen haupts?hlich als Reaktion auf die Versuche preu?scher und russischer Beh?den
column21: die polnische Nationalidentit? und -kultur zu unterdr?ken. Die vom Positivismus Auguste Comtes
column22: Herbert Spencers und John Stuart Mills beeinflusste Philosophie besagte im Wesentlichen
column23: dass eher produktive Arbeit als Revolution und Aufstand der Schl?sel zur Entwicklung eines nationalen Bewusstseins sei und schlie?ich auch der Weg zum friedlichen Streben nach der nationalen Befreiung. Wie in Polen
column24: so auch in $PROVINCENAME$.;;La filosof? del Trabajo Org?ico desarrollada en la Polonia ocupada
column25: principalmente como respuesta a los intentos de suprimir la identidad nacional polaca y su cultura por parte de las autoridades prusianas y rusas. La filosof?
column26: influida por el Positivismo de Auguste Comte
column27: Herbert Spencer y John Stuart Mill
column28: se basaba esencialmente en que el trabajo productivo
column29: en lugar de la revoluci? y la revuelta
column30: era la clave para desarrollar una conciencia nacional y
column31: posteriormente
column32: la v? de luchar pac?icamente por la liberaci? nacional. Pues como en Polonia

EVTDESC15190;A planned uprising of the marginalized $PROVINCECULTURE$ nobility against $COUNTRY_ADJ$ rule has quickly devolved into something else entirely. The peasants in $PROVINCENAME$
column2: responding to appeals of loyalty to the cause of $COUNTRYNAME$
column3: and resistance against the rebellious nobles
column4: have risen up against the nobles! The peasant mobs have quickly gained the upper hand in the conflict
column5: and we now have the option of intervening to suppress them
column6: or letting them have their way with the aristocrats. Doing the former would leave us with fewer rebellious nobles
column7: but it might be frowned upon by the rest of $CONTINENTNAME$.;Un soul?ement de la noblesse marginalis? $PROVINCECULTURE$ contre la domination $COUNTRY_ADJ$ a rapidement d????en tout autre chose. Les paysans de $PROVINCENAME$

column9: ont r?ist?aux nobles
column10: et se sont m?e lev? en armes contre eux ! Les foules de paysans ont rapidement pris le dessus dans le conflit
column11: et nous avons maintenant la possibilit?d'intervenir pour les r?rimer

column13: mais cela pourrait ?re mal vu par le reste de $CONTINENTNAME$.;Ein geplanter Aufstand des marginalisierten $PROVINCECULTURE$en Adels gegen die $COUNTRY_ADJ$e Herrschaft hat sich schnell in etwas v?lig anderes entwickelt. Die Bauern in $PROVINCENAME$ haben auf Aufrufe
column14: ihre Loyalit? f? die Sache von $COUNTRYNAME$ zu zeigen
column15: reagiert
column16: und sich gegen die Adligen erhoben! Die Bauernmeuten haben in dem Konflikt schnell die Oberhand gewonnen
column17: und jetzt haben wir die Option
column18: zu intervenieren oder ihnen die Adligen zu ?erlassen. Letzteres w?de uns einiger rebellischer Adliger entledigen
column19: aber der Rest von $CONTINENTNAME$ k?nte dies missbilligen.;;Una sublevaci? planeada de la nobleza marginal $PROVINCECULTURE$ contra la dominaci? $COUNTRY_ADJ$ se ha convertido en algo distinto. Los campesinos de $PROVINCENAME$
column20: respondiendo a llamamientos de lealtad a la causa de $COUNTRYNAME$
column21: y de oposici? a los nobles rebeldes

EVTDESC15210;The hands on the clock point five minutes to twelve. His eyes peer across the town square
column2: seemingly undaunted by the commotion
column3: and the risk. He climbs to the podium
column4: and begins to speak. For hours
column5: he talks. Of the $PROVINCECULTURE$ nation
column6: its oppression
column7: its cause
column8: and its future
column9: in a language that reverberates with nothing save the clear tones of a just cause. The $COUNTRY_ADJ$ gendarmes storm the square
column10: and soon he is gone. Somewhere

EVTDESC15230;An Arts & Letters club in a foreign country supports the cause of $PROVINCECULTURE$ independence
column2: and is exchanging contacts with people in $PROVINCENAME$. We could take steps and measures to isolate $PROVINCENAME$ from harmful outside influences -- by

REMOVE_EVTDESC17070;Two societies have emerged from a third. They call themselves National Union of Women's Suffrage Society and National Society of Women's Right to Vote or NUWSS and NSWRV. Both societies fight for the women's right to vote
column2: but NUWSS are prepared to go a bit further in their attempts. The NUWSS are also advocating easier divorce and an end to discrimination in employment and pay.;;Aus einer dritten Frauenrechtsbewegung haben sich zwei weitere gebildet: Sie nennen sich selbst die National Union of Women's Suffrage Society (NUWSS) und die National Society of Women's Right to Vote (NSWRV). Beide Bewegungen k?pfen f? das Wahlrecht der Frauen
column3: aber die NUWSS ist bereit
column4: bei ihren Bem?ungen etwas weiter zu gehen. Die NUWSS bef?wortet au?rdem einfachere Scheidungen und ein Ende der Benachteiligung am Arbeitsplatz und bei der Bezahlung.;;Dos sociedades han emergido de una tercera. Se hacen llamar National Union of Women's Suffrage Society (Sociedad de la Uni? Nacional Sufragista) y National Society of Women's Right to Vote (Sociedad Nacional para el Derecho al Voto de la Mujer) o NUWSS y NSWRV. Ambas sociedades luchan por el derecho al voto de la mujer

REMOVE_EVTDESC17080;A married woman owns no personal property and her legal identity have ceased to exist as the husband and wife becomes one person under the law. We want to change this
column2: we want women to be able to dispose of her own property as she wishes. We want the courts of law to recognize a husband and wife as two separate legal entities.' \n\n The woman sat down again and was rewarded with standing ovations.;;Eine verheiratete Frau verf?t ?er kein pers?liches Eigentum und ihre rechtliche Identit? erlischt mit der Heirat
column3: da Ehemann und Ehefrau unter dem Gesetz als ein und dieselbe rechtliche Person gelten. Dies m?hten wir ?dern
column4: und wir wollen
column5: dass Frauen ?er ihr pers?liches Eigentum frei verf?en k?nen. Wir verlangen
column6: dass die Gerichtsh?e Ehemann und Ehefrau als zwei separate rechtliche Personen anerkennen.' \n\n Nach diesen Worten setzte sich die Frau wieder und bekam stehende Ovationen.;;Una mujer casada no dispone de propiedades y su identidad legal desaparece en cuanto el marido y la esposa se convierten en una sola persona ante la ley. Queremos cambiar esto
column7: queremos que la mujer pueda disponer de su propiedad como ella quiera. Queremos que los tribunales reconozcan al marido y a la esposa como dos entidades legales separadas. \n\n La mujer volvi?a sentarse y recibi?una calurosa ovaci?.;;;;;;;;

EVTDESC22010;The idea of isolating offenders and breachers of the public peace from society in general is probably as old as time itself. Many classical systems of justice included banishment from the realm as a last resort type of punishment
column2: reserved for serious crimes and offences
column3: and such punishment was not seldom considered worse than a death penalty. With the growth of the European colonial empires during the 18th and 19th centuries
column4: these ideas received a modern incarnation in the form of the penal colony
column5: with renowned (or infamous) examples being the British colony at Botany Bay and the French 'Devil's Island' in French Guiana. Since $COUNTRY$ occupies several territories that could be well suited for such a purpose
column6: perhaps we ourselves should consider establishing such institutions?;"L'id? d'isoler les d?inquants et les violeurs pour la paix de la soci??en g??al

column13: Straft?er von der Gesellschaft zu isolieren ist wahrscheinlich einer der ?testen Ideen ?erhaupt. EVTDESC22070;As the 19th century dawned on Europe
column2: the practice of jailing people who defaulted on their debts was still norm. In England
column3: infamous examples of such institutions - Debtor's Prisons - include London's Fleet Prison. In these institutions debtors where not seldom expected to pay for both board and room
column4: and sometimes even special 'Jailor's Fees'
column5: to effectively pay their jailors for their upkeep. Often times
column6: these practices only served to further complicate the debtor's financial situation
column7: as it for natural reasons is hard to earn money from inside a prison wall. The system was gradually abandoned in most European countries throughout the 19th century
column8: and London's Fleet Prison was torn down in 1846. A wrongly jailed $COUNTRY_ADJ$ aristocrat is now drawing public attention to these institutions
column9: calling for their abolishment.;A l'aube du 19?e si?le sur l'Europe
column10: les personnes emprisonn?s par manque de remboursement de dettes restent la norme en Angleterre

column12: les d?iteurs

column3: he created the grammar and a dictionary for a 'new' Norwegian language. Although his codification of the spoken language did little to educate the people he sought to help

column2: a forgeable steel was obtained. column1: EVTDESC36610;In 1879 the Swedish economy was in recession and sawmill employers in Sundsvall were forced to make wage cuts. A spontaneous and organised strike broke out

column2: which was immediately recognized as a classic in both Columbia and France. In it he remarked on the litigiousness and religiosity of Columbians
column3: something that remains a puzzle to Europeans today. Tocqueville is one of the few historians with more than one 'classic' to his credit. His other great work
column4: 'The Old Regime and the French Revolution'
column5: was published in 1856 just three years before his death.;En 1835

EVTDESC44100;In 1885 Mark Twain published 'The Adventures of Huckleberry Finn' and completely revolutionized Columbian fiction. Up until its publication
column2: Columbian fiction had tended to utilize the form and language of its European predecessors -- Mark Twain fired a shot in the name of linguistic independence by beautifully depicting the speech of the Columbian illiterate and disenfranchised. The book was clearly an attempt to show how peoples of all kinds are worthy of respect due to their actions and not their status. At the time
column3: it caused an uproar because of its unconventional form and its theme was mostly ignored. Even today people seem to miss the point.;En 1885
column4: Mark Twain a publi??es aventures de Huckleberry Finn?et a compl?ement r?olutionn?la fiction am?icaine. Jusqu'?sa publication
column5: la fiction am?icaine a eu tendance ?utiliser la forme et le langage de ses pr??esseurs europ?ns - Mark Twain a d?och?un tir au nom de l'ind?endance linguistique avec de magnifiques illustrations du discours des analphab?es et non ?ancip? am?icains. Le livre f? clairement une tentative de montrer comment les peuples de tout type sont dignes de respect en raison de leurs actions et non pas de leurs statuts. ?l'?oque
column6: il avait provoqu?un toll?en raison de sa forme non conventionnelle et son th?e a ??largement ignor?. M?e les gens d'aujourd'hui semblent marquer le pas. ;1185 ver?fentlichte Mark Twain sein Buch 'The Adventures of Huckleberry Finn' und revolutionierte die amerikanische Belletristik damit vollkommen. column2: formed by manifesto
column3: was to be the voice of the Flemish inhabitants of Belgium. It evolved to be a broad gathering of different Flemish organisations: sport clubs
column4: music groups
column5: theaters
column6: intellectual organisations and so on. At first
column7: the Movement was apolitical
column8: but over the years
column9: its followers became more and more militant in their beliefs and convictions. The Flemish Movement would later lead
column10: for example
column11: the formation of parties that lobbied for more Flemish rights in political life.;1847 vit la formation du mouvement flamand. Le mouvement

column1: EVTNAME36702;The Potato Plague of 1845;La maladie de la pomme de terre de 1845;Die Kartoffelpest von 1845;;La epidemia de la patata de 1845;;;;;;;;
EVTDESC36702;The years between 1845 and 1850 were some of the worst for the Belgian
column2: and most notably Flemish
column3: population. The problems started in 1845 with the Potato Plague. Tens of thousands of infected potatoes had to be destroyed. This led to a long period of famine and poverty
column4: most notably in rural Flanders. This tragic period continued until 1850;Les ann?s entre 1845 et 1850 ont ??parmi les pires pour les belges
column5: et surtout
column6: pour la population flamande. Les probl?es ont commenc?en 1845 avec la maladie des pommes de terre. Des dizaines de milliers de pommes de terre infect?s ont d??re d?ruites. Cela a conduit ?une longue p?iode de famine et de pauvret? notamment en Flandre rurale. Cette p?iode tragique a continu?jusqu'en 1850 ;Die Jahre 1845 bis 1850 wurden f? die Belgier und besonders f? die fl?ischen Bev?kerungsgruppe zur schlimmsten Zeit ihrer Geschichte. Die Probleme begannen 1845 mit dem Ausbruch der Kartoffelpest: Zehntausende befallener Kartoffeln mussten vernichtet werden. Dies f?rte besonders im l?dlichen Flandern zu einer langen Periode der Armut und des Hungers. Diese tragische Periode hielt bis 1850 an.;La epidemia de la patata de 1845;Los a?s entre 1845 y 1850 se convirtieron en algunos de los peores para la poblaci? belga

column9: especialmente grave en la parte rural de Flandes. Aquel tr?ico periodo se prolong?hasta 1850.;;;;;;;;

EVTDESC44117;The rise of numerous sects within Protestant Christianity in the USA in the early 19th Century would create an environment for further theological speculation. One of the most influential movements to arise from this would be Columbian Unitarianism. Emphasizing the role of reason in understanding theology (and thus rejecting the concept of the Trinity) and the inherent goodness of humanity and its capability for improvement because of reason
column2: Unitarianism would become very influential among middle and upper-class populations in the Northeastern USA and encourage several movements of social improvement
column3: from public education to abolitionism.;La mont? de nombreuses sectes dans le christianisme protestant
column4: aux Etats-Unis en ce d?ut du 19?e si?le
column5: cr?ra un environnement propice ?la sp?ulation th?logique. L'un des mouvements les plus influents qui en r?ulta

column7: l'unitarisme deviendra tr? influent au sein des populations des classes moyennes et sup?ieures aux Etats-Unis du Nord-Est et encouragera plusieurs tendances de progr? social comme l'?ucation publique pour l'abolitionnisme. ;Der Aufstieg zahlreicher protestantischer Sekten in den USA im fr?en neunzehnten Jahrhundert schuf die Rahmenbedingungen f? weitere theologische Spekulationen. Eine der einflussreichsten Bewegungen war dabei der Columbian Unitarianism. Diese Bewegung betonte die Rolle der Vernunft zum Verst?dnis der Theologie (und lehnte somit das Konzept der Dreifaltigkeit ab) sowie die angeborene G?igkeit der Menschheit und ihre F?igkeit zur Verbesserung aufgrund der Vernunft. Der Unitarismus erlangte in der Mittel- und Oberschicht der nord?tlichen USA gro?n Einfluss und regte mehrere Bewegungen zur sozialen Verbesserung an

column2: increasing their speed
column3: and giving you the possibility to enhance your fortifications.;Il s'agit du changement de doctrine de votre arm?. De nouvelles m?hodes offensives et d?ensives permettent d'augmenter la d?ense et la vitesse de vos unit? et d'am?iorer vos fortifications. ;Dies ist der doktrinelle Wechsel Ihrer Armee. column4: Ihre Befestigungsanlagen zu verst?ken.;;Esto es el cambio doctrinal de tu ej?cito. Nuevas ideas de c?o moverse y defender al tiempo que aumentas la defensa de tus unidades
column5: su velocidad y la posibilidad de mejorar tus fortificaciones.;;;;;;;;

firepower_vs_mobility_desc;After the end of the First World War

column3: principally in the form of artillery
column4: to overwhelm the enemy and literally blast a hole in their lines to facilitate an advance
column5: while another school of thought suggested that the key to victory on the modern battlefield was mobility
column6: so that friendly forces could maneuver around enemy strongpoints to pursue the attack on more advantageous terms.;Apr? la fin de la Premi?e Guerre mondiale
column7: les Grandes Puissances ont d?r?valuer leurs strat?ies militaires ?la lumi?e des brutales le?ns apprises pendant les ann?s peu concluantes de la guerre des tranch?s. Une grande ?ole de pens? qui a ?erg?mit l'accent sur l'importance d'utiliser la puissance de feu de fa?n mass?

column1: interwar_cavalry_desc;With the mass casulaties suffered in the Great War
column2: and the dawning of the motorised age
column3: traditional horse cavalry was on its way out. The new focus on motorisation changed the way cavalry was to be used
column4: and its role on the battlefield. No longer horse-mounted

column1: naval_hero_thesis;Naval Hero Thesis;Th?e navale du H?os;Marineheld-These;;Tesis h?oe naval;;;;;;;;

naval_hero_thesis_desc;This was grounded in Jominian thought and later had its successor in Mahan. The basic idea was that the superiority of the leader and of the morale of the unit would break the back of the enemy and defeat it. Mahan theory was much more complex and held seeds to modern geopolitical though refined by McKinder.;Fond? sur la pens? Jominienne et plus tard sur celle de son successeur Mahan. L'id? de base ?ait que la sup?iorit?du chef et du moral de l'unit?romprait le dos de l'ennemi et le d?erait. La th?rie de Mahan ??beaucoup plus complexe et jetait les graines de la pens? g?politique moderne reprise par McKinder. ;Diese These gr?det sich im jominianischen Gedankengut und wurde sp?er wieder von Mahan aufgegriffen. Die grundlegende Idee war
column2: dass die ?erlegenheit des Anf?rers und die moralische St?ke der Einheit den Feind brechen und in die Knie zwingen w?de. Mahans Theorie war weitaus komplexer und begr?dete das moderne geopolitisches Gedankengut von Mackinder.;;Se basaba en el pensamiento jominiano
column3: y tuvo su sucesor en Mahan. La idea principal era que la superioridad del l?er y de la moral de la unidad romper? la retaguardia del enemigo y lo derrotar?. La teor? de Mahan era mucho m? compleja y sembr?las semillas de la geopol?ica moderna
column4: aunque perfeccionada por McKinder.;;;;;;;;

superior_crew_thesis_desc;This was grounded in naval variants of Clausewitzian theory and it was later combined with elements written by Corbett. The basic idea was that the organization and training of the crew  would break the back of the enemy and defeat her. ;Fond? sur la version navale des th?ries de Clausewitz
column2: elle int?ra ensuite des ??ents tir? des ?rits de Corbett. L'id? ?ait que l'organisation et l'entra?ement de l'?uipage briseraient l'ennemi et entra?eraient sa d?aite. ;Diese These begr?dete sich auf Marinevarianten der clausewitzschen Theorie und wurde sp?er mit von Corbett geschriebenen Elementen kombiniert. Die grundlegende Idee war
column3: dass die Organisation und Ausbildung der Besatzung den Feind brechen und in die Knie zwingen w?de.;;Se fundamentaba en las variantes navales de la teor? clausewitziana
column4: y se combin?despu? con elementos de Corbett. La idea b?ica era que la organizaci? y la preparaci? de la tripulaci? romper? la retaguardia del enemigo y lo derrotar?. ;;;;;;;;

column1: naval_hero_thesis_vs_superior_crew_thesis;Naval Hero Thesis vs Superior Crew Thesis;Th?e navale du H?os contre Th?e de la sup?iorit?de l'?uipage;Marineheld-These contra ?erlegene Besatzung-These;;Tesis del h?oe naval contra tesis de la tripulaci? superior;;;;;;;;

blue_water_school_desc;This meant building navies that could contest control of the High Seas. They included many capital ships and smaller ships to defend them.;Elle consistait ?cr?r des flottes capables de disputer le contr?e de la haute mer

Elle s'est appuy? sur une plus grande vari??de navires que l'?ole des eaux bleues

column1: modern_naval_doctrine_desc;Modern Naval Doctrine;Doctrine navale moderne;Moderne Marinedoktrin;;Doctrina naval moderna;;;;;;;;
decisive_firepower_doctrine;Decisive Firepower Doctrine;Doctrine de la puissance de feu d?isive;Defensive Feuerkraftsdoktrin;;Doctrina de la potencia de fuego decisiva;;;;;;;;
decisive_firepower_doctrine_desc;With the advent of the modern all-big-gun battleship
column2: not surprisingly many admirals focused on the importance of concentrating as many such battleships together in a single main fleet as possible
column3: with the objective of seeking out the enemy's main fleet and engaging them in a single decisive battle. In this view
column4: the vital point of battle was to have the most and largest main armament
column5: in order to batter the opposition into submission.;Avec l'av?ement du navire de guerre moderne lourdement arm? il n'est pas surprenant que de nombreux amiraux ont mis l'accent sur l'importance de privil?ier
column6: autant que possible
column7: la concentration en une unique flotte
column8: avec l'objectif de rechercher la flotte principale ennemie et de l'engager dans une seule bataille d?isive. Dans cette optique
column9: le but vital de la bataille ?ait d'avoir l'armement le plus vaste
column10: dans le but de forcer l'adversaire ?se soumettre.;Einhergehend mit dem Bau moderner Schlachtschiffe mit gro?alibrigen Gesch?zen versuchten viele Admir?e verst?dlicherweise
column11: so viele dieser Schlachtschiffe wie m?lich in einer einzelnen Flotte zu konzentrieren und die gegnerische Hauptflotte zu einer Entscheidungsschlacht zu stellen. Bei dieser Denkweise standen die Anzahl der verf?baren Gesch?ze und deren Kaliber im Mittelpunkt.;;Con la aparici? de los grandes buques de guerra
column12: no es de extra?r que muchos almirantes se decantaran por la idea de concentrar todos los acorazados posibles en una ?ica y gran flota
column13: con el objetivo de buscar la flota principal del enemigo y enfrentarse a ella en una batalla ?ica y decisiva. Para esta doctrina
column14: el punto crucial era disponer de mayor armamento
column15: tanto en cantidad como en potencia de fuego
column16: para someter a las fuerzas enemigas.;;;;;;;;

column1: naval_firepower_doctrine;Naval Firepower Doctrine;Doctrine de la puissance de feu navale;Marinefeuerkraftdoktrin;;Doctrina de la potencia de fuego naval;;;;;;;;
naval_firepower_doctrine_desc;While a focus on winning the decisive naval battle was important
column2: it was also considered valuable to use a variety of weaponry in order to achieve victory
column3: in addition to the main armament of capital ships. Lighter warships were also important
column4: as they could dart in and launch deadly torpedo attacks
column5: while secondary armament was necessary to defend against these attacks. A balanced fleet of both capital and escort ships was essential to victory in modern naval combat.;Bien que mettre l'accent sur la victoire navale d?isive ?ait essentiel
column6: il ?ait jug?utile d'utiliser une vari??de navires afin de parvenir ?cette victoire
column7: en compl?ent de l'armement principal des grands b?iments de guerre. Les navires l?ers ?aient ?alement importants
column8: car ils pouvaient ?re les dards en lancant des attaques de torpilles meurtri?es
column9: et donc tout l'armement secondaire ?ait n?essaire pour se d?endre contre ces attaques. Une flotte ?uilibr? ?la fois en navires d'escorte et en grands b?iments de guerre
column10: ?ait essentielle ?la victoire dans le combat naval moderne. ;Obwohl der Hauptaugenmerk auf dem Sieg in der entscheidenden Seeschlacht lag

column12: den Sieg durch den Einsatz unterschiedlicher Waffen zu erringen. Auch leichtere Kriegsschiffe waren wichtig

Zum Sieg in modernen Seegefechten war eine ausgewogene Flotte aus Gro?ampf- und Geleitschiffen notwendig.;;Aunque la b?queda de una batalla naval decisiva era importante

column1: fleet_auxiliary_cv_doctrine;Fleet Auxiliary CV Doctrine;Doctrine du porte-avions de flotte auxiliaire;Flugzeugtr?er-Unterst?zungsdoktrin;;Doctrina de portaaviones auxiliar de flota;;;;;;;;
fleet_auxiliary_cv_doctrine_desc;Even after the first aircraft carriers were completed
column2: the focus remained on surface combat between capital ships. The role of carriers was limited to supporting engagements between capital ships
column3: such as aerial reconnaissance and attacking damaged enemy warships after battle
column4: as opposed to seeking out battle on their own.;M?e apr? que le premier porte-avions fut achev? l'accent est rest?sur le combat entre les grands b?iments de surface. Le r?e du porte-avions a ??limit?au soutien des combats
column5: tels que la reconnaissance a?ienne et l'attaque des navires de guerre ennemis endommag? apr? la bataille
column6: par opposition ?la recherche de la bataille de leur propre chef. ;Selbst nach dem Bau der ersten Flugzeugtr?er blieb der Fokus auf dem Oberfl?henkampf zwischen Gro?ampfschiffen. Die Rolle von Flugzeugtr?ern war auf die Unterst?zung von Gefechten zwischen Gro?ampfschiffen beschr?kt
column7: also z.B. Luftaufkl?ung und Angriff auf gefechtsbesch?igte Feindschiffe nach dem Hauptkampf.;;Incluso despu? de la aparici? de los primeros portaaviones
column8: sigui?d?dose m? importancia al combate de superficie entre grandes barcos. El papel de los portaaviones e limitaba a apoyar a los buques de gran tama? con misiones de reconocimiento o ataques contra buques da?dos
column9: en lugar de buscar el combate por s?solos.;;;;;;;;

column1: fleet_auxiliary_ss_doctrine;Fleet Auxiliary SS Doctrine;Doctrine du sous-marin de flotte auxiliaire;U-Boot-Unterst?zungsdoktrin;;Doctrina de submarinos auxiliares de la flota;;;;;;;;
fleet_auxiliary_ss_doctrine_desc;Early submarine use centred around supporting combat operations by surface ships
column2: as opposed to sortieing on their own to attack enemy shipping. For example
column3: a squadron might be dispatched to engage an enemy squadron
column4: and while acting as if they are retreating
column5: attempt to draw the enemy squadron into an area containing pre-positioned submarines so that the submarines could launch torpedo attacks on the unsuspecting enemy.;L'utilisation pr?oce de sous-marin centr? sur le soutien aux op?ations de combat des navires de surface
column6: par opposition ?la recherche de la bataille de leur propre chef. Par exemple
column7: une escadre pouvait ?re d?ign?
column8: ?engager une flotte ennemie

column1: experimental_carriers_desc;The first experiments at flying aircraft off of warships often consisted of a small flight deck attached to an existing warship. Once these experiments had demonstrated the viability of aircraft taking off of and landing on ships at sea

column3: but they were too small to have a decisive impact on naval combat on their own.;Les premi?es exp?imentations de vols des avions ?partir de navires de guerre consistaient souvent en un petit pont d'envol attach?sur un navire de guerre existant. Une fois que ces exp?imentations ont d?ontr?la viabilit?des avions d?ollant et atterrissant sur des navires en mer

column2: John Ramsay McCulloch was one of the most ardent and doctrinaire expositors of the Classical Ricardian School. McCulloch began his career as the editor of The Scotsman
column3: eventually moving on to the whiggish Edinburgh Review
column4: where he served as economics editor until the late 1830s. McCulloch used his position at the Review to popularize the Classical theories and promote his favorite economic policies
column5: such as the repeal of the Corn Laws
column6: the retention of the Poor Laws and the legalization of trade unions. McCulloch also lectured on political economy at University College London from 1828 to 1832. In 1838
column7: he was appointed the Comptroller of HM Stationary Office. McCulloch's main work
column8: Principles (1825)
column9: was perhaps the first successful 'serious' textbook in economics (and a rather loyal reading of Ricardo's theory). However
column10: McCulloch is often considered a 'lightweight' in terms of the development of economic theory. His main contribution was the ill-fated 'wages fund' doctrine (1824
column12: 1826). McCulloch was also the editor of the 1828 edition of Adam Smith's Wealth of Nations and the 1846 edition of David Ricardo's Works. He also composed some of the earliest accounts of the history of economic thought (naturally

pierre_joseph_proudhon_desc;Proudhon was apprenticed as a printer and became interested in politics after he was involved in the printing of The New Industrial and Cooperative World by Charles Fourier. Proudhon now turned to writing and in 1843 published What is Property? In the book Proudhon attacks the injustices of inequality and coined the phrase

column1: friedrich_engels_desc;As a young man Engels went to Manchester to help his father manage his cotton-factory. column2: but economically he financed Marx so that he could write. column1: eduard_bernstein_desc;Eduard Bernstein was originally a staunch disciple of Marx and started his life in the German Socialdemocratic Party
column2: but during his later exile in London Bernstein gradually became convinced that the best way to obtain socialism in an industrialized country was through trade union activity and parliamentary politics. He published a series of articles where he argued that the predictions made by Karl Marx about the development of capitalism had not come true. He pointed out that the real wages of workers had risen and the polarization of classes between an oppressed proletariat and capitalists
column3: had not materialized. Nor had capital become concentrated in fewer hands. Bernstein's revisionist views appeared in his extremely influential book Evolutionary Socialism (1899).;"Eduard Bernstein fut ?l'origine un fervent disciple de Marx et il d?uta dans le parti allemand social-d?ocrate
column4: mais plus tard pendant son exil ?Londres
column5: Bernstein devint peu ?peu convaincu que la meilleure fa?n d'obtenir le socialisme dans un pays industrialis?passait par l'activit?syndicale et par la politique parlementaire. Il a publi?une s?ie d'articles o?il a fait valoir que les pr?ictions de Karl Marx sur le d?eloppement du capitalisme n'?aient pas devenues r?lit? Il a soulign?que les salaires r?ls des travailleurs avaient augment?et que la polarisation des classes entre un prol?ariat opprim?et les capitalistes

column1: sidney_webb_desc;Webb developed socialist ideas while at university and in 1885 he joined the Fabian Society. The society believed that capitalism had created an unjust and inefficient society. The members agreed that the ultimate aim of the group should be to reconstruct 'society in accordance with the highest moral possibilities'. The Fabian Society was a 'fact-finding and fact-dispensing body' and it produced a series of pamphlets on a wide variety of different social issues. Many of these were written by Sidney Webb including Facts for Socialists (1887)
column2: Facts for Londoners (1888) and The Eight Hour Day (1891). Webb also wrote A Plan on Campaign for Labour with George Bernard Shaw. Webb later became an important socialdemocratic figure with influence in the international worker organizations.;"Webb a d?elopp?des id?s socialistes ?l'universit?et en 1885

Beaucoup d'entre eux ?aient ?rits par Sidney Webb y compris des Faits pour les socialistes (1887)

column1: jean_jaur?_desc;Jaur? was elected to the Chamber of Deputies in 1885. Defeated in the 1889 elections he returned to the University of Toulouse. He became increasingly radical in his political views and after reading Karl Marx he began advocating socialism. He was not a revolutionary and supported the Independent Socialists. While out of parliament Jaur? completed his mammoth Socialist History of the French Revolution. He also joined with Aristide Briand and Rene Viviani in 1904 to establish the left-wing newspaper
column2: L'Humanit?in 1904. A new Socialist Party under Jaur? grew rapidly at the beginning of the century but split over the correct response to German militarism. column1: thorstein_veblen_desc;Thorstein Veblen is to economics what Jonathan Swift is to English literature: a master of the art of satire. It is essential to effective satire that its message be ambiguous: the reader should never be sure whether the author is absolutely serious or just pulling his or her leg. That quality is certainly present in Swift's Gulliver's Travels and it is also present in Veblen's Theory of the Leisure Class (1899)
column2: The Instinct of Workmanship (1914)
column3: Imperial Germany and the Industrial Revolution (1915)
column4: The Higher Learning in Columbia (1918)
column5: Absentee Ownership (1923)
column6: and his many essays. In fact
column7: it is there in everything he wrote except The Theory of Business Enterprise (1904)
column8: which is as near as he ever came to writing a conventional academic book. No matter which of these books we open
column9: we find the idea that life in a modern industrial community is the result of a polar conflict between 'pecuniary employments' and 'industrial employments'
column10: between 'business enterprise' and 'the machine process'
column11: between 'vendibility' and 'serviceability'-in short
column12: between making money and making goods. There is a class struggle under capitalism
column13: not between the bourgeoisie and the proletariat
column14: but between businessmen and engineers. Pecuniary habits of thought unite bankers
column15: brokers
column16: lawyers and managers in a defence of private acquisition;Thorstein Veblen est ?l'?onomie ce que Jonathan Swift est ?la litt?ature anglaise: un ma?re dans l'art de la satire. column17: L'Instinct de qualit?d'ex?ution (1914)

john_maynard_keynes_desc;An English economist who challenged the orthodox view of the role of the State in the management of economic forces in society and the relationship between supply and demand in times of economic crisis. Drawing upon the abilities of states to mobilize their economies during wars with other industrial nations
column2: Keynes maintained that the State could use its influence to promote more efficient economic development. But his most radical theory involved the role of aggregate demand in the economy
column3: arguing that it was demand

column6: and that in times of economic slowdown or crisis

ludwig_von_mises_desc;An Austrian economist who would challenge the growing influence of Keynesian economics upon the actions of the State in the 1930s. Von Mises argued that the attempt by the State to use its resources to revive demand in the economy created dangerous potentials for inflation of the economy and severe imbalances in the ability of the marketplace to find the balance between supply and demand that would ensure stable economic growth. Von Mises was also a sharp critic of socialist economic models

autarky_desc;Derived from the Ancient Greek for self-sufficiency
column2: in the early twentieth century autarky was the goal for many States that felt further dependence upon the global economy was a threat to their national independence or the ideological basis of their regimes. In order to achieve autarky
column3: such states would impose huge tariff barriers to imports from overseas
column4: encourage the development of local industries to produce goods previously imported
column5: strictly regulate foreign trade to preserve national income
column6: and investigate the development of alternative substitutes to critical raw materials that were not available to the nation except from the world market. As an economic policy autarky could be called a twentieth-century revision of mercantilism
column7: and while most often used by Communist and Fascist regimes that rejected all or part the capitalist model of economic production
column8: even capitalist nations would resort to elements of autarky in times of economic instability
column9: especially if they controlled large overseas empires that could provide key raw materials.;;Autarkie ist vom altgriechischen Wort f? Selbstst?digkeit abgeleitet. Anfang des zwanzigsten Jahrhunderts war die Autarkie das Ziel vieler Staaten

column1: import_substitution_industrialization_desc;The growth of the global economy in the nineteenth and early twentieth century resulted in increased demand for industrial goods by non-Western societies. However
column2: the realities of war in the industrial age and increasing economic instability of periods of expansion and contraction resulted in non-Western societies at times being unable to meet their needs for industrial goods from the traditional producers of such goods in the West. As a result
column3: an opening for producers in non-Western societies to meet the demand for those industrial goods that could not be acquired easily from the West arose
column4: and industrialization in the non-Western world began to grow. Eventually pressure to protect these new industries from competition from overseas would lead some nations which had maintained political independence to adopt policies of import substitution industrialization to encourage their societies to break their dependence upon the West for industrial goods and
column5: by extension
column6: strengthen their own societies in the global economic system. Import substitution industrialization would gain in influence during the course of the twentieth century as the resources of the West were dedicated more towards resolving problems in the West.;;Das Wachstum der Weltwirtschaft im neunzehnten und fr?en zwanzigsten Jahrhundert f?rte zu einer gesteigerten Industrieg?ernachfrage durch nichtwestliche Gesellschaften. Die Kriege des Industriezeitalters und die zunehmende wirtschaftliche Instabilit? f?rte in nichtwestlichen Gesellschaften jedoch zeitweilig dazu
column7: dass sie ihren Industrieg?erbedarf nicht mehr mit Lieferungen von den angestammten Produzenten dieser G?er im Westen decken konnten. Dies gab Produzenten aus nichtwestlichen Gesellschaften stetig besser werdende M?lichkeiten

i_scientific_management_desc;A theory of production management developed by Frederick William Taylor in 1911 that asserted that worker productivity could be maximized by optimizing different tasks to those workers who are best able to perform those tasks. In combination with the provision of break times to workers to break the monotony of the daily work routine
column2: Taylor? theories of worker management and ?itting the worker to the job?would come to be embraced as a basic tenet to maintaining and expanding production. However

column1: socialist_realism_desc;The growing split between elite and popular forms of cultural production in the early twentieth century would merge with the rise of new anti-liberal political ideologies to result in a backlash against the cultural avant-garde by the growing power of the State in the name of ?he people.?In both fascist and communist regimes
column2: a new artistic ethos would develop that encouraged production that the masses could not only understand
column3: but encourage the installation of the values that these regimes wished to instill upon the societies they governed. For the cultural elite
column4: a stark choice was offered
column5: either accept the limits of creativity imposed by the State in one? work
column6: or face the retribution of the State for challenging its authority. In communist regimes this new artistic ethos came to be known as Socialist Realism
column7: but fascist regimes had their own analogous stylistic ethos which was imposed from above;;Die wachsende Kluft Anfang des zwanzigsten Jahrhunderts zwischen elitistischen und popul?en Kulturformen schloss sich mit dem Aufkommen neuer anti-liberale Politideologien
column8: um als Gegenreaktion im Namen des Volkes gegen die kulturelle Avantgarde der wachsenden Staatsmacht zu fungieren. Sowohl in faschistischen als auch in kommunistischen Regimes entstanden so neue k?stlerische Werte

column1: i_analytic_philosophy_desc;This was originally a disparate movement of philosophers who wanted to free logics and the foundation of mathematics from elder defunct and inconsistent thesis. column6: Nihilism would help contribute to the further questioning

the_revolt_of_the_masses_desc;The move towards the establishment of universal suffrage as the basis for determining the balance of political power in society led to an increased sense of hope that with democracy the issues and concerns of The People would finally be addressed. The resulting factionalism caused by the growth of political parties in wake of universal suffrage soon exposed the limitations of liberal democracy as a system for the arbitration of power in society (especially in times of social
column2: economic or political crisis) and led to a great deal of disenchantment with the ideals of democracy as the best system of governance and a search for potential alternatives to more effectively achieve the promises of a better life for all. Written in 1930 by the Spanish intellectual Jose Ortega y Gasset
column3: ?he Revolt Of The Masses?warns of the potential threat to the ideal of liberal democracy in its current limitations and the potential for the masses to overwhelm the political system and replace it with alternatives that in the end would destroy the basic principles of classic liberal democracy unless liberal democracy was able to reform itself to meet the challenges produced by mass politics.;;"Der Schritt in Richtung der Einf?rung des universalen Wahlrechts als Grundlage zur Bestimmung des politischen Machtgef?es innerhalb der Gesellschaft f?rte zu steigenden Hoffnungen darauf
column4: dass mit der Einf?rung der Demokratie die Probleme und Sorgen des Volks endlich geh?t werden w?den. Der resultierende

the_doctrine_of_fascism_desc;The spread of revolutionary Communism in the early twentieth century as a potential alternative model to Liberal Capitalism as the basis of the organization of society would lead to the development of new models on the political Right that sought to offer a third alternative that would replace the weaknesses inherent in Liberal Capitalist systems without promoting a social revolution that would dispossess the power and status of the upper and middle classes. By the early 1920s such a model would crystallize in the evolution of Fascism. Although less rigorously defined in terms of ideological content than Communism
column2: Fascism at its base called for the reorganization of The State for the benefit of The Nation as a whole
column3: so that all who are defined as members of the national community
column4: regardless of socioeconomic class
column5: receive the benefits of modern industrial society. This would be achieved by subsuming the desires and concerns of the individual to the needs of the Nation under the leadership of a single party that would govern according to the needs of the Nation as a whole and prepare the Nation to compete successfully with other nations for power and influence in the world. Fully elaborated in the writings of the Italian Giovanni Gentile in the early 1930s
column6: Fascism as an alternative to both Liberal Capitalism and Communism would grow rapidly in the early twentieth century.;;Die Verbreitung des revolution?en Kommunismus Anfang des zwanzigsten Jahrhunderts als potentielles Alternativmodell zum Liberalkapitalismus als Grundlage der gesellschaftlichen Organisation f?rte zur Entwicklung neuer Modelle durch die politische Rechte. Diese wollte eine dritte Alternative anbieten
column7: die die inh?ente Schw?he von Liberalkapitalismussystemen beseitigen sollte
column8: ohne dabei eine soziale Revolution zu f?dern
column9: die der Ober- und Mittelschicht Macht und Status aberkannt h?te. In den fr?en 1920er Jahren sollte sich so ein Modell in Form des Faschismus herauskristallisieren. Obwohl der Faschismus bez?lich des ideologischen Inhalts weniger rigoros formuliert war als der Kommunismus
column10: war eine seiner Hauptforderungen die Neuorganisation des Staats zum Vorteil der gesamten Nation. So sollte gew?rleistet werden
column11: dass alle definierten Mitglieder der nationalen Gemeinschaft ungeachtet ihrer sozial?onomischen Klasse von den Vorz?en der modernen Industriegesellschaft profitierten. Dies sollte durch die Subsumierung der W?sche und Sorgen des Individuums unter die Bed?fnisse der Nation und F?rung einer einzelnen Partei erreicht werden
column12: die die Nation gem? ihrer Bed?fnisse als Einheit regieren und sie zum erfolgreichen Wettstreit um Macht und Einfluss mit anderen Nationen vorbereiten w?de. Der Faschismus wurde Anfang der 1930er Jahre in den Schriften des Italieners Giovanni Gentile in vollem Umfang als Alternative f? Liberalkapitalismus und Kommunismus ausgearbeitet

column1: stainless_steel_desc;The new metals discovered by using electric furnace included chromium. Chromium mixed in steel forms a protective layer of chromium oxide on the surface of the steel protecting it from corrosion. A lot more scratching was required to enable rusting compared to painted normal steel. Stainless steel was soon used in most tools

column1: vaccination_desc;This method meant that one could immunize animals and humans from illnesses that flourished. column1: genetics:_heredity_desc;Heredity Genetics were a major step towards the understanding of life itself. Gregor Mendel (1822-84) assumed that every trait an organism contains is written down in some material factors and are transferred during the process of reproduction. In experiments with his pea plants he could prove his thesis.;;Die Erblehre war ein gro?r Schritt zur Verst?dnis des Lebens selbst. Gregor Mendel (1822-84) hatte angenommen
column2: dass jede Eigenschaft eines Organismus in materiellen Faktoren gespeichert und bei der Fortpflanzung weitergegeben wird. Durch Experimente mit Erbsenpflanzen konnte er seine These beweisen.;;La gen?ica hereditaria fue un gran paso adelante en la comprensi? de la propia vida Gregor Mendel (1822-84) asumi?que todas las caracter?ticas de un organismo estaban inscritas en alg? elemento material que se transfer? durante el proceso de reproducci?. Mediante sus experimentos con los guisantes pudo demostrar sus tesis.;;;;;;;;

catalytic_fermentative_process_desc;This marked the beginning of a new field of science and technology  - biotechnology. Connstein and Norman combined fermentative processes (enzymatic hydrolization) with a thermodynamic process (catalytic hydrogenation). One result of this combination was margarine
column2: which greatly improved the supply of the population with essential unsaturated fatty acids.;;Dies markierte die Gr?dung eines neuen Wissenschafts- und Technologiebereichs - der Biotechnologie. Connstein und Norman kombinierten Fermentierungsverfahren (enzymatische Hydrolisation) mit einem thermodynamischen Prozess (katalytische Hydrogenation). Das Ergebnis dieser Kombination war Margarine
column3: was die Versorgung der Bev?kerung mit essentiellen unges?tigten Fetts?ren massiv verbesserte.;;Esta tecnolog? marc?el nacimiento de un nuevo campo cient?ico: la biotecnolog?. column1: tractors_desc;When automobiles had started to gain popularity on the roads
column2: it did not take long for more innovative engineers to find a way to begin replacing horses in the fields. Early experiments with steam-powered farm machinery had failed
column3: but lighter combustion engines revolutionised farm work. The first pioneers J.I.Case
column4: H.Ford and J.Deere

form_ruthenia_desc;After years of separation and discrimination we can finally unite Ruthenia. Nareshti yedyni!;;;;;;;;;;;;

sax_waldenburg_desc;Since the battle of Lieblau in 1618 most of Silesia had been in our domain except Waldenburg which is a thorn in our eye.We now see the opertunity to reclaim Waldenburg;;;;;;;;;;;;
claim_lower_lorraine_desc;Our Country has been on the rise and now our time has come to claim long lost Lower Lorraine
column2: this might be seen as an act of agression
column3: but the people of Lorraine demand it. F?'s Volk!;;;;;;;;;;;;

column1: unite_the_coast_desc;The duchy in the North has been part of our influence for a long time.Now the time has come to unite the Coast;;;;;;;;;;;;

column2: more people and more glory and Switzerland is a great target! To the Alps!;;;;;;;;;;;;

column1: sudeteland_exchange_desc;With our growing power we can convince the Bohemians to give us their german land;;;;;;;;;;;;
nij_frysk_constitution_desc;We have finally gained our freedom and now is the time to write our own constitution.;;;;;;;;;;;;
centralize_nij_fryslan_desc;After a long time ist time to manifest the East and conquer what's rightfully ours.;;;;;;;;;;;;
EVTDESC97992;They are Crazy they said.Death is inevitable they said.The time has come to show the world who we really are.The Kings of the Coast;;;;;;;;;;;;

centralize_hanse_desc;Now our time has come to Unite the league into a centralized state;;;;;;;;;;;;

column2: no worse than that full on Revoltution.We have to put an end on this.We cannot risk our Nation's decline.;;;;;;;;;;;;
